intro: Wittia costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican wittia, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth surface and is often found in moist, shaded habitats. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 3 meters in height. Wittia costaricensis plays an important ecological role in its native habitat by providing nectar for pollinators.
